Word Search II

House Robber II

You are a professional robber planning to rob houses along a circle street. Each house has a certain amount of money stashed, the only constraint stopping you from robbing each of them is that adjacent houses have security systems connected and it will automatically contact the police if two adjacent houses were broken into on the same night. 
 
Shortest Palindrome

Given a string s, you can convert it to a palindrome by adding characters in front of it. Find and return the shortest palindrome you can find by performing this transformation.
 
Kth Largest Element in an Array

Find the kth largest element in an unsorted array. Note that it is the kth largest element in the sorted order, not the kth distinct element.

 
Combination Sum III

Find all valid combinations of k numbers that sum up to n. 
 
Contains Duplicate

Given an integer array nums, return true if any value appears at least twice in the array, and return false if every element is distinct.
 
The Skyline Problem

Given the locations and heights of all the buildings, return the outline of the buildings. The outline is represented as a list of [startPoint, height] pairs. 
 
Contains Duplicate II

Given an integer array nums and an integer k, return true if there are two distinct indices where the difference between the indices is at most k.
 
Contains Duplicate III

Given an integer array nums and two integers k and t, return true if there are two distinct indices where the absolute difference between nums[i] and nums[j] is at most t and the absolute difference between i and j is at most k.
 
Maximal Square

Given a 2D binary matrix filled with 0's and 1's, find the largest square containing only 1's and return its area.
 
Count Complete Tree Nodes

Given the root of a complete binary tree, return the number of the nodes in the tree.
 
Rectangle Area

Find the total area covered by two rectilinear rectangles in a 2D plane.
 
Basic Calculator

Implement a calculator to evaluate a basic expression string.
 
Implement Stack using Queues

Invert Binary Tree

Basic Calculator II

Implement a basic calculator to evaluate a simple expression string.
 
Summary Ranges

Majority Element II

Given an integer array of size n, find all elements that appear more than ⌊ n/3 ⌋ times.
 
Kth Smallest Element in a BST

Power of Two

Given an array of integers A, a move consists of choosing any A[i], and incrementing it by 1. Return the least number of moves to make every value in A unique. 
 
Validate Stack Sequences

Given two sequences pushed and popped with distinct values, return true if and only if this could have been the result of a sequence of push and pop operations on an initially empty stack. 
 
Most Stones Removed with Same Row or Column

On a 2D plane, we place stones at some integer coordinate points. Each coordinate point may have at most one stone. 
 
Bag of Tokens

You have an initial power P, an initial score of 0 points, and a bag of tokens. Each token can be used at most once, has a value token[i], and if you have at least token[i] power, you may play the i-th token, gaining token[i] points. 
 
Largest Time for Given Digits

Given an array of 4 digits, return the largest 24 hour time that can be made. 
 
Reveal Cards In Increasing Order

You are given a deck of cards, there is one guaranteed sequence in which to deal the cards one by one. Starting with the deck upside down, take the top card off the deck and reveal it, then put it on the table. Take the next card off the top and put it on the bottom of the deck in your hand. Continue this process until all cards are revealed. You want to do this in a way that reveals the cards in increasing order.
 
Flip Equivalent Binary Trees

For a binary tree T, we can define a flip operation as follows: choose any node, and swap the left and right child subtrees. A binary tree X is flip equivalent to a binary tree Y if and only if we can make X equal to Y after some number of flip operations.
 
Largest Component Size by Common Factor

Given a non-empty array of unique positive integers A, consider the following graph: There are A.length nodes, labelled A[0] to A[A.length - 1]; There is an edge between A[i] and A[j] if and only if A[i] and A[j] share a common factor greater than 1. Return the size of the largest connected component in the graph.
 
Verifying an Alien Dictionary

In an alien language, surprisingly they also use english lowercase letters, but possibly in a different order. The order of the alphabet is some permutation of lowercase letters. Given a sequence of words written in the alien language, and the order of the alphabet, return true if and only if the given words are sorted lexicographicaly in this alien language.
 
Array of Doubled Pairs

Given an array of integers A with even length, return true if and only if it is possible to reorder it such that A[2 * i + 1] = 2 * A[2 * i] for every 0 <= i < len(A) / 2.
 
Delete Columns to Make Sorted II

Given an array of strings A, if we want to make it sorted in lexicographically increasing order, at least D[i] number of columns need to be deleted. Return the minimum D[i] required.
 
Tallest Billboard

You are installing a billboard and want it to have the largest height. The billboard will have two steel supports, one on each side. Each steel support must be an equal height.
 
Prison Cells After N Days

There are 8 prison cells in a row, and each cell is either occupied or vacant. After one day, if a cell has two adjacent neighbors that are both occupied or both vacant, then the cell becomes occupied. Otherwise, it becomes vacant.
 
Check Completeness of a Binary Tree

Given a binary tree, determine if it is a complete binary tree.
 
Regions Cut By Slashes

In a N x N grid composed of 1 x 1 squares, each 1 x 1 square consists of a /, \, or blank space. These characters divide the square into disjoint regions.
 
Delete Columns to Make Sorted III

Given an array of strings A, where each string is a sequence of characters, let's form a column. The i-th column [A[0][i], A[1][i], ..., A[A.length-1][i]] forms a non-decreasing sorted list. We can choose a subset of the columns and remove them (making the new length of the string), then the column formed will still have the property mentioned above. Return the minimum possible removals of any permutation of the array that result in sorted columns.
 
N-Repeated Element in Size 2N Array

In an array of size 2N, there are N+1 unique elements, and exactly one of these elements is repeated N times. Return the element repeated N times.
